intro: Cirsium fontinale var. fontinale, commonly known as the meadow thistle, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and tall, purple to pinkish flower heads that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in grasslands, meadows, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are composite, consisting of both ray florets and disk florets, typical of the Asteraceae family. The plant is known for its robust growth and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
